creator: Oliver.Moehrke@web.de
text:
Created attachment 28569
Test file to embed another PDF file a create a basic-link to it.

The possiblity to create a basic-link for an embedded PDF file seems to be broken since the nightly build generated on 2012-03-27.

While the embedded PDF file can still be accessed via "attachments" using Adobe Reader 10.1.2, the mouse pointer does not change to the "hand", to allow following the link anymore.

No error logging occurs, when generating the PDF from the xsl-fo.
Using the nightly build 2012-03-26 works.

creator: Oliver.Moehrke@web.de
text:
Created attachment 28570
Test file that should be embedded.

creator: gadams@apache.org
text:
vincent, this regression seems related to your commit at

http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1305467

could you take a look at this? thanks, glenn

creator: gadams@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> vincent, this regression seems related to your commit at

vincent, are you able to look at this? thanks, glenn

(In reply to comment #3)
> (In reply to comment #2)
> > vincent, this regression seems related to your commit at
> > 
> > http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1305467
> > 
> > could you take a look at this? thanks, glenn
> 
> vincent, are you able to look at this? thanks, glenn

Vincent: just in case you will have a look at this. Embedded files are launched via a javascript action. Check the method PDFFactory.getActionForEmbeddedFile() and the class PDFJavaScriptLaunchAction.

HTH

Matthias
creator: matthias8283@gmx.at
bowditch_chris@hotmail.com
text: Vincent is on vacation this week, so he won't be looking at this in the short term.

Should be fixed in rev. 1330451:
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=1330451&view=rev

Thanks for reporting this issue.
Vincent
